content.description: SDS with left hand low crimp and right hand jug. Climb up the low overhang and top out. Crux is getting over the lip when topping out.
content.location: Top of the talus field towards the middle. To the right of One Trick Pony.

content.description: SDS with a sloper on the left arête and a low in-cut. Pull off the ground and make a few powerful bumps before compressing the prow and getting your hands on those glorious horns at the top.
content.location: Directly beneath the overhanging wall at the top of the talus field (up and left of the crazy fin feature)

content.description: Crouch start matched on low juggy hold. Climb up using the arete and good holds along the face. Fun movement with crux at the top.
content.location: Up and to the right of the shark fin feature. Near the start of the bluffs and to the right of the overhanging bluffs above the shark fin feature.

content.description: Start on two sloping edges in the back of the roof. Work some foot magic to gain the lip before taking the brutal release and riding slick quartzite slopers to the mantle. All detached blocks are off!
content.location: Roof at the bottom left of the talus.

content.description: Climb from two central jugs up to top of boulder. Arete is off til top out.
content.location: Center of the tali’s field, directly below shark fin feature.

content.description: SDS with right hand on arete and left hand on prominent jug. Climb up the arete through good holds and top out. Crux is getting over the lip on the top out, as it is slightly overhanging.
content.location: Middle of the talus field, right below shark fin feature

content.description: A few boulders scattering in a large scree pile. Climbs are generally short and powerful.
